ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:0.5_0: The second training rule on swaying the head
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were swaying and hanging their heads while sitting in inhabited areas. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not sway my head while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:1.4_0: he should not sway his head while sitting in inhabited areas;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:1.5_0: one should sit keeping one’s head straight.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:1.6_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, sways and hangs his head while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:1.13_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:1.16_0: The tenth rule, the training rule on tenth rule, is finished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:1.17_0: The second sub-chapter on laughing loudly is finished.
